awards.text: Death in the name input screen
Get an apple from the gatekeeper
Find the hidden places in hell outlands
Discover that the gatekeeper has pending university debt

quests.title: Join Hellfire Club
quests.subtitle: You receive an invitation from the gatekeeper to join the club
description: Some souls get to be pre-selected for Hellfire, based on the particulars of the time of death.
This bound generates a curse on the person; until you clear your name from their boards, you will be
returning to hell to fullfill this contract, over and over.
Reach out for the ~abandoned outpost~ immediately to further instructions.

itens.name: DeathFruit
itens.formula: /giveA Life -20;/giveA Mana -10;/msgRnd You feel nausea and vomits.|Aaaargh!|A acid grey goo comes out of your ears|You fall on the ground in pain.

itens.name: Rope
itens.description: Simple rope to climb or descend places.

itens.name: Wood_piece
itens.description: A small sized wood, good for a fire.

itens.name: Bone
itens.description: Old bone from a dead person or animal.

traits.name: Fortitude
traits.description: Brings extra coins every now and then...

traits.name: BadLuck
traits.description: Not an easy life all around. Gold will be reduced.

traits.name: Annoying
traits.description: You complain. A LOT. There will be punishment in gold.

traits.name: Sex_Pervert
traits.description: Girls get you 'in the mood'. Some NPCs wont come close.

traits.name: Religious
traits.description: Your mana is weak, and magic around you tend to fail.

traits.name: BadHealth
traits.description: Your max life is constantly below. Some damage can kill you.

traits.name: Karma
traits.description: All encounters will be difficult. Luck will be reduced.

traits.name: Guilt
traits.description: Penalties in dexterity and experience. You give up easily.

traits.name: Smelly
traits.description: Not all NPCs will engage easily with you.

traits.name: Frail
traits.description: Your strength will be reduced, and courage will be limited.

traits.name: Clumsy
traits.description: Your luck will be affected, along with dexterity

traits.name: Drunk
traits.description: You always seek beer and get high.

traits.name: Human
traits.description: The human race from the continent.

traits.name: Dwarf
traits.description: The dwarf race from the mountains.

traits.name: Elf
traits.description: The elf race from the forests.

stages.label: Game Over!!
text: Without even playing! Are you serious?!

stages.label: Soul Selection
text: Please select your soul to play, with a origin story (and disadvantage):
^1^ - "Sarah"   [Neg. Trait: ~Guilt~]
^2^ - "Gilbert" [Neg. Trait: ~BadLuck~]
^3^ - "Lionel"  [Neg. Trait: ~Religious~]
^4^ - "Anne"    [Neg. Trait: ~BadHealth~]
^5^ - "Burt"    [Neg. Trait: ~Karma~]
^6^ - "Jonesy"  [Neg. Trait: ~Smelly~]
^7^ - "Phil"    [Neg. Trait: ~Frail~]
^8^ - "Anthony" [Neg. Trait: ~Clumsy~]
^9^ - ** random soul **
hint: A soul is your character previous origin story.
It gives a bad particular because of his time of death.

stages.label: The curse of Gilbert - I
text: Won the lottery and had a heart attack.
look: You are seeing your previouos life in a flash.

stages.label: The curse of Lionel - I
text: His wife was possessed and he was killed by a wood crucifix.
look: You are seeing your previouos life in a flash.

stages.label: The curse of Anne - 1
text: A veteran that lost himself on drugs and died of overdose.
look: You are seeing your previouos life in a flash.

stages.label: The curse of Burt - I
text: Killed a stranger out of anger (car rage) and then got hit by a bus.
look: You are seeing your previouos life in a flash.

stages.label: The curse of Sarah - 1/5
text: "I'm out for groceries!" Sarah said with a big yawn to her husband Paul, while searching for the car keys in her
big pockets full of lollipops from work. She was still wearing her white jacket with the name ^Dr. Sarah Allis Smith^
embroidered in blue letters and the italic 'Pediatrician' dashed in her coat.
Paul got off the couch and quickly went to the kitchen, as he was hungry.
"We are out of.. pizza and all the usual things..." answered Paul, looking sad at the almost empty fridge at
a friday night. "Wait. Let me see if we need more stuff.." said the man in his forties, with a beer lite in
his other hand.
Sarah was exhausted after a long shift at the clinic. Winter was officially coming next week, and lots of little
people with their 'big' problems were coming too -- some came with a fever, but most consults, unfortunately, were
just of scared parents in post-COVID times who couldn't handle a simple cold, or a sore throat from their children
without going mental.
look: You are seeing your previouos life in a flash.

stages.label: The curse of Sarah - 2/5
text: Sara was waiting and looking at the TV, but her mind went full automatic as Paul searched the kitchen,
naming things and opening (and closing) drawers.
But she could not forget one of her patient's father saying: "Please, save my child!"
The doctor thought that there was nothing wrong about being scared. She was a mom as well, and she also
got the scare of her life when Danny had his first seizure, entirely out of the blue. Of course, epilepsy
is treatable, and we are not in the dark ages anymore. So, no evil possession or demons from hell; simple
medicine from the pharmacy solves the problems (at least most of it).
Sometimes, when Danny looked directly into Sarah's eyes, she would get anxious. Her mind played again the
first time she saw the rolling up eye and the shaking: her husband had to act immediately, pushing her aside
and screaming for help -- ~all she did was stare and do nothing~ while Paul rolled the boy to the side and
stuck two fingers in the child's mouth.
Whenever she heard the word ~panic~ in her work, she understood the crying, the pain and the paralysis. Sarah
almost speaks to the parents like talking to herself: 'It is not your fault mom', 'Try not to panic dad',
'It is natural and expected to be scared, but we carry on, scared or not because is our duty to protect them'
look: You are seeing your previouos life in a flash.

stages.label: The curse of Sarah - 3/5
text: "Mommy, can I go with you?" said eleven-year-old Daniel, jumping close his mother.
Sarah, absorbed in her thoughts and insecurities, gave a little step back: "Jesus, Danny. You
scared me!" she said, trying to show the little one a smile.
They entered the car with a complete grocery list. Sarah opened her window after putting on the
seatbelts as Paul approached and said: "Love if you are tired, let me do this. I can.."
She smiled and said: "No. I need to keep my mind off work. It was crazy today."
"Oh. Sorry to hear that. You two come back safely, okay?" said Paul giving a goodbye sign.
Sara sighed and kept looking straight: "Okay. I'm going."
Daniel waved to his father and said: "Bye, daddy!"

stages.label: The curse of Sarah - 4/5
text: After closing the garage and well into the city, Sarah received a message on her cellphone:
^Buy Danny Meds^
She punched the wheel and said: "Damn Paul, you couldnt do this by yourself? Fucking shit!"
Arriving at the red traffic light, she looked left and right, deciding whether to go to the grocery
or the pharmacy. There was a decision, and she was barely awake from her sixteen-hour shift.
"Fuck!" she muttered, realizing not having the energy to do both things.
Sarah looked at Danny, who had not had a seizure in six months and had almost no incidents at
his school: the perfect child.
"Are you alright, my baby?"
Daniel said with a smile: "Yeah, mommy. Look, look! The sign is green, go! Burguers!"
Sarah sighed again and turned left without a single doubt in her mind.
After crossing the road, in the next intersection a speeding police car ~struck them directly~
~in the side~, causing the vehicle to be thrown sideways and rolled over several times.

stages.label: The curse of Sarah - 5/5
text: The car was tilted upwards, and Sara had her legs crushed by the severity of the impact.
She could not feel her lower torso anymore, and there was blood flowing in volumes from her head,
making red patches on her face.
The mother looked to the right for her son, and there he was: trembling in the dark.
"Danny! D-dannie, oh my God!" she yelled, releasing the seat belt and falling on the floor.
The child continued shaking.
When Sara dragged herself over in front of the boy being held by the seatbelt, she saw his small
face locked in terror, the mouth foaming, having a strong epilepsy seizure. His eyes were wide
in a bloody grimace, and when the mother saw his dislocated, broken neck, she started to scream.
Before having a final and deadly heart attack, Sara stood paralyzed in horror, watching her boy
suffering in his last moments of agony. ~Her mind glared at the fact that they could be safe if~
~she followed Paul's request to get Danny's medication.~
Until her last breath, she stared at Danny and did nothing as the boy ~died~ in front of her.

stages.label: The curse of Jonesy - I
text: Homeless man being torched after witnesses a robbery.
look: You are seeing your previouos life in a flash.

stages.label: The curse of Phil - I
text: Kill after being pushed from the stairs from bullies in school.
look: You are seeing your previouos life in a flash.

stages.label: The curse of Anthony - I
text: Brave soldier killed in iraq (after drop a grenade on himself after getting shot in the shoulder).
look: You are seeing your previouos life in a flash.

stages.label: Player Name
text: After being engulfed in a pure white light for hours, your soul projects itself
into another location. From within a pulsating ^yellow translucid orb^, your new
body is sexless and bald: a completely generic clone floating safely inside the water
in that healing sphere.
You can see yourself in a desert at night, with a strange sky. A massive hundred-meter-
tall dark rock wall in front of you extends left and right for miles.
Ahead, a small monk is sweating because of the enormous heat from this desert.
A closed iron gate is behind him, only lit by a couple of fires in stakes.
The monk speaks with a ~deep and supernatural~ voice: "Greetings, I am the gatekeeper.
Tell me your name, please?"
Your orb descends into the ground, and your bubble bursts -- all the liquid goes down
the sand, and your body slowly evaporates all the fluid in a vapor mist by the
desert heat.
"What is this... place?" you ask, stupefied.
"Your name, please." said the monk, sighing loudly. "I need it for the books."
look: You come close to the ancient monk, and ask: "Are.. are you for real?"
He smiles and give you an apple and some coins.
/giveI Apple 1;/giveI Gold 20;/award 3
"Is this real enough for you?" the monk replies with a chuckle.
hint: Always inspect the scene with '/look'
Always check your inventory with '/bag'

stages.label: Player Name
text: You scratch your head and look around: "What is happening?"
"Hey, new guy: wake up already. Your name again?" said the ^tired monk^.
You look at your strange hands and get startled: "This does not look like myself."
The gatekeeper review his annotations in a big book: "Don't worry. This strangeness is expected."
"Am I really... dead?" you said in ~terror~.
"Just give your name, and things will start improving" said the monk.
The realization comes to you quickly: there will be no home to come back to. After
that, you start to cry and fall on your knees.
The gatekeeper touches your head and says: "So... your name, please?"
look: The gatekeeper is trying to keep you calm, but he is about to lose his patience.
hint: Give your name...

stages.label: Player Name
text: "Is this a fucking joke? How can this be possible?" you say, desperate.
"Oh boy, not another stupid one.." said the monk in exasperatoin.
"Look pal, this is my job. People come in and I write their names; and off they go
beyond that gate to have a ^NICE ADVENTURE^."
The gatekeeper and you look angry to each other for a while.
You cant help but to give another tantrum: "~FUCK YOU! Where is your supervisor?~"
The gatekeeper roars: "Your name! GIVE IT TO ME!"
look: The monk face is red. He is about to explode!
hint: Give your name before you face consequences!

stages.label: Player Name
text: You look at the warning sign ^ANNOYING^ holding in the air; the letters are magically
persistent.
"You asked for this!" said the gatekeeper pointing his finger at you.
You try to erase the announcement with your hands, and all the text became particles
floating loosely in the wind.
"AM I ANNOYING TO YOU? I FUCKING JUST DIED!" you scream to the old man.
Your face slowly fades from anger to sobbing again.
"Have a little.. patience with me..." you say with a small voice, covered in tears.
'Your ~name~?' ask the angry monk, slowly.
hint: Just give him your name, already! People these days... I miss the 80s.

stages.label: Player Name
text: "Tell me your name; its easy." said the monk, with a red face of anger.
look: The monk had a virtuos patience with you, poor soul.
hint: Now face the consequences...

stages.label: Player Name
text: "Name?" ask the monk. "One last chance!"
look: The monk looks for something inside his own bag.
hint: Please write your name dude...

stages.label: Player Name
text: "Go back to your fucking light!" said the monk, taking a shotgun from his bag.
"Wait..WAIT!" you scream, putting a hand in front of you and the mad gatekeeper.
~BOOOMM~
Your head explode; the bloody clone hit the ground dead.
While the curse is upon you, you will be back again in four hours.
look: Yeap. Monks with guns. Deal with it.
hint: Better luck next life!

stages.label: Build selection
text: The monk speaks: "{name}, you have been pre-selected to join the ~Hellfire club~.
Each time you experience death, you will come back here untill you break the curse.
As your soul traveled here, you can manifest to a different physical body in this dimension."
The small man gives out a gesture and magic numbers and letters appear in front of you:
1 - Human Mage
2 - Elf Fighter
3 - Human Thief
program: /giveA Strength 1;/giveA Inteligence 5;/giveA Vitality 2;/giveA Dexterity 2;/giveA Mana 19;/giveA ManaMAX 19;/giveA Life 60;/giveA LifeMAX 60;/giveT Human;/title Human_Mage;/giveI Gold 100
/giveA Strength 4;/giveA Inteligence 3;/giveA Vitality 5;/giveA Dexterity 5;/giveA Mana 3;/giveA ManaMAX 3;/giveA Life 120;/giveA LifeMAX 120;/giveT Elf;/title Elf_Fighter;/giveI Gold 100
/giveA Strength 3;/giveA Inteligence 4;/giveA Vitality 3;/giveA Dexterity 3;/giveA Mana 2;/giveA ManaMAX 2;/giveA Life 60;/giveA LifeMAX 60;/giveT Human;/title Human_Thief;/giveI Gold 100
look: The gatekeeper is bored. He is bound to a 100 year contract.
Like all monks from Hell, he has a lot of university debt, so he took the job.
/award 8
hint: Sometimes NPCs like to be given something..
(*cough) shiny (*cough)
to offer better things... use /give!

stages.label: Build selection [2]
text: "What is it, now {name}?" ask the monk.
"Why I need to select anything? A thief? Give me a break" you replied.
The monk shakes his head: "Look, we are in HELL. Being criminal is almost expected."
"Nope. Not me." you reply.
The monk clears the signs: "Okay. Lets do this one more time."
1 - Human Stupid
2 - Human Lazy
3 - Human Weak
program: /giveA Strength 3;/giveA Inteligence 2;/giveA Vitality 2;/giveA Dexterity 2;/giveA Mana 1;/giveA ManaMAX 1;/giveA Life 60;/giveA LifeMAX 60;/giveT Human;/title Human_Stupid;/giveI Gold 10
/giveA Strength 3;/giveA Inteligence 3;/giveA Vitality 3;/giveA Dexterity 2;/giveA Mana 1;/giveA ManaMAX 1;/giveA Life 30;/giveA LifeMAX 60;/giveT Human;/title Human_Lazy;/giveI Gold 10
/giveA Strength 2;/giveA Inteligence 3;/giveA Vitality 3;/giveA Dexterity 2;/giveA Mana 1;/giveA ManaMAX 1;/giveA Life 20;/giveA LifeMAX 60;/giveT Human;/title Human_Weak;/giveI Gold 10
hint: Sometimes NPCs like to be given something..
(*cough) shiny (*cough)
to offer better things... use /give!

stages.label: Build selection [3]
text: "Do you have another set?" you ask very politely.
The monk scratch his head and say: "Ok. But dont spread gossip around that
I allow cheating, okay?"
"Right! Give me something more.. wild. I want to be... a giant barbarian!"
The monk clears the signs: "Last chance for you..."
1 - Dark Elf Assassin
2 - Human Psion
3 - Dwarf Bard
program: /giveA Strength 4;/giveA Inteligence 5;/giveA Vitality 5;/giveA Dexterity 5;/giveA Mana 11;/giveA ManaMAX 11;/giveA Life 110;/giveA LifeMAX 110;/giveT Elf;/title Dark_Elf_Assassin;/giveI Gold 100;/goto 12:1

/giveA Strength 2;/giveA Inteligence 4;/giveA Vitality 3;/giveA Dexterity 3;/giveA Mana 15;/giveA ManaMAX 15;/giveA Life 80;/giveA LifeMAX 80;/giveT Human;/giveT Sex_Pervert;/title Human_Psion;/giveI Gold 100;/goto 12:1

/giveA Strength 3;/giveA Inteligence 4;/giveA Vitality 3;/giveA Dexterity 3;/giveA Mana 2;/giveA ManaMAX 2;/giveA Life 60;/giveA LifeMAX 60;/giveT Dwarf;/giveT Drunk;/title Dwarf_Bard;/giveI Gold 100;/award 7;/goto 12:1
hint: Sometimes NPCs like to be given something..
(*cough) shiny (*cough)
to offer better things... use /give!

stages.label: Build selection (after a bribe...)
text: "So, Mr. {name}, thank you for your kindness. Please choose your physical form."
1 - Human Mage
2 - Elf Fighter
3 - Human Thief
The monk checks his books.
"Hum.. Let me see what I have more... Ha!"
4 - Dwarf Engineer
5 - Human Cleric
program: /giveA Strength 1;/giveA Inteligence 5;/giveA Vitality 2;/giveA Dexterity 2;/giveA Mana 19;/giveA ManaMAX 19;/giveA Life 60;/giveA LifeMAX 60;/giveT Human;/title Human_Mage;/give Gold 100;/goto 12:1
/giveA Strength 4;/giveA Inteligence 3;/giveA Vitality 5;/giveA Dexterity 5;/giveA Mana 3;/giveA ManaMAX 3;/giveA Life 120;/giveA LifeMAX 120;/giveT Elf;/title Elf_Fighter;/give Gold 100;/goto 12:1
/giveA Strength 3;/giveA Inteligence 4;/giveA Vitality 3;/giveA Dexterity 3;/giveA Mana 2;/giveA ManaMAX 2;/giveA Life 60;/giveA LifeMAX 60;/giveT Human;/title Human_Thief;/give Gold 100;/goto 12:1

/giveA Strength 3;/giveA Inteligence 2;/giveA Vitality 4;/giveA Dexterity 6;/giveA Mana 7;/giveA ManaMAX 7;/giveA Life 50;/giveA LifeMAX 50;/giveT Dwarf;/giveT Drunk;/title Dwarf_Engineer;/give Gold 100;/goto 12:1

/giveA Strength 3;/giveA Inteligence 4;/giveA Vitality 3;/giveA Dexterity 3;/giveA Mana 11;/giveA ManaMAX 11;/giveA Life 80;/giveA LifeMAX 80;/giveT Human;/giveT Fortitude;/title Human_Cleric;/give Gold 100;/goto 12:1
look: The gatekeeper is happy counting coins.
give: Apple 1|/msgN I love apples! Thanks {name}! Here are some change for you...;/give Gold 20

stages.label: Still at the gates of Hell
text: Your body is lifted from the ground, and you are given clothes and the specifics from
your character choice. A big travel backpack is also given to you.
"Well, good luck, Mr. {name}. Off you go to your adventure!"
textOptional: /getAL Strength 3:/msgO "You look a little too weak for this place, my friend. Watch out!"
/getAM Vitality 4:/msgO "We need strong soldiers like you!"
/getT Human:/msgO "Most humans all go to hell anyway, hehe."
/getT Elf:/msgO "Hey... Elves never come here... are you crazy?"
/getPlayerTitle Human_Cleric:/msgO "Clerics come here more often, I dont know why." said the monk with a enigmatic smile.
look: The gatekeeper is reading a book, and then wide his eyes looking at you:
"Jesus! I almost forgot, here is a letter of comendation to join the ~hellfire club~."
/giveI Letter_Comendation 1
With the letter, you walk away from the gate while the monk disappears in
a flash of green smoke.
/goto 20
hint: Nowhere to go. Better go /look somewhere else...

stages.label: Hell - outlands [at the gates]
text: You watch the landscape of Hell stupefied. It looks like a grand canyon,
with big rock walls on your left and right.
The yellow sand on your feet has black spots mixed all over; the sky is
constantly changing its colors from purple to a darkened brown, just like
the aurora borealis in the Earth -- but in here, it looks like the aftermath
of a nuclear explosion.
look: There are lots of skeletons from differents animals all around.
The smell of decomposition is terrible.
hint: Check your /map for a detailed view of your surroundings.

stages.label: Hell - outlands [at the death tree]
text: You now stand in the shadow of the big tree. The leafs are extremely
unnatural in this desert context. You feel uneasy as there is a smell
of rot and blood near you.
"A proper tree from Hell!" you register in your mind.
There is a river close by, with a ancient wood bridge.
The sound of water comes by a waterfall in your left.
look: These fruits look like oranges, but bigger and have some greenish worms
visible, and they make horrible sounds while they eat. There is a grey
goo in the ground from their chewing.
hint: Sometimes you can just /take things from the ground...

stages.label: Hell - outlands [at the river crossing bridge (Left)]
text: You arrived at the remains of a fairly old and partially broken bridge
(at the left section). The small river that crosses the valley cuts deep
within the rocks at the margin, with absurd violence.
The wooden pass slowly moves up and down by the wind.
All that water comes from a ^massive waterfall^ on your left, nearby.
You notice that even in Hell there could be beauty.
look: You can cross this old bridge, but there is a chance of falling.
The sound of water is frightening.
mapProgram: /nextLocation 42|/getAE Dexterity 3:/giveA Life -5,/msgR Light damage from the wooden pass
/nextLocation 42|/getAE Dexterity 2:/giveA Life -10,/msgR Damage from the wooden pass
hint: If you cross the bridge, you probably get hurt!

stages.label: Hell - outlands [at the river crossing bridge (Right)]
text: The wooden pass slowly moves up and down by the wind.
You can see the the abandoned outpost nearby.

stages.label: Hell - outlands [at the abandoned outpost]
text: Outpost text.

stages.label: Hell - waterfall [at the entrance]
text: After climbing all the way up the tall rock structure, you see a ~trapdoor~ almost
hidden in the desert sands, near the south side of the outpost.
In front of you, behind the massive waterfall, there is a small passage between some rocks
and the water.
You feel that you can enter this hidden cave, if you jump.
look: Near the waterfall, but on the other side, you can see a glimmer of metal
near a big corpse. Using a rope and the rocks nearby, you could go there.
mapProgram: /nextLocationTitle Human_Mage:80||/msgR Mages don't use ropes, sorry.
/nextLocationI Rope,1?Twigg,1?:80|/msgR You use the rope and a twigg to reach your destination.|/msgR You need a rope and a twigg to continue.
hint: When looking from above, you can see more things.. in the /map

stages.label: Hell - waterfall [cave start]
text: After jumping.

stages.label: Hell - waterfall [Skeleton]
text: Skeleton text.

stages.label: Hell - waterfall [Fire remains]
text: Fire remains text.

stages.label: Hell - waterfall [Troll Lair]
text: Troll Lair text.

stages.label: Hell - trapdoor
text: Waterfall text.
look: You see a trapdoor almost hidden in the desert sands.
hint: When looking from above, you can see more things.. in the map

stages.label: Hell - slain demon corpse on the ground
startupProgram: /getAE Dexterity 5:/giveA Life -1,/msgR Minor damage occurred while climbing down the rope.
/getAE Dexterity 4:/giveA Life -3,/msgR Minor damage occurred while climbing down the rope.
/getAE Dexterity 3:/giveA Life -6,/msgR Light damage occurred while climbing down the rope.
/getAE Dexterity 2:/giveA Life -15,/msgR Damage occurred while climbing down the rope.
/getAE Dexterity 1:/giveA Life -30,/msgR Critical damage occurred while climbing down the rope.
text: After using the rope, you notice a demonic being rotting away from a
battle that occurred not too long ago.
His head is severed from his body and some parts are already filled with worms.
The smell is pungent and you feel light headed.
look: There is a rusty sword next to the demonic figure.
/giveI Rusty_Sword 1
/award 10
hint: When looking better, you can find hidden things.
